Description: Brass lamp: carinated bowl-body and short rounded nozzle, the top dished and the wick-hole circular. The top is open and stepped at the edge to receive a wide lid, now lost, the broken hinge-piece of which survives at the rear of the lower stem of a cross-shaped handle-ornament; ring-handle below the cross, with a small thumb-piece. The lamp stands on a simple base-ring. Surface colouration: patchy green, with large areas of iron staining; piece of corroded iron adhering to the inside and shoulder.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (3788)
Xanthopoulou 2010 / Les lampes en bronze à l’époque paléochrétienne (LA 7.018)
